name: Cheshire Day Ranger
description:
CHESHIRE DAY RANGER Unlimited travel for one day with weekday time restrictions in the Cheshire, Merseyside and Greater Manchester areas encompassing Chester, Liverpool, Manchester, Buxton and 
      Stoke-on-Trent and on the West Coast Main Line it is valid between Warrington Bank Quay and Crewe.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £31.20 child (5-15): £15.60 16-17 saver: £15.60 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V : £20.75 FF H V child fare: £5.90 Railcards ⯈ Railcard: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £29.80 2023 - £28.40 2022 - £26.80 2021 - £25.20 2020 - £25.20 2019 - £24.50 2018 - £23.80 2014 - £22.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:00 but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays route restrictions Not valid east of Manchester Victoria train operating companies Avanti West Coast, CrossCountry, East Midlands Railway, London Northwestern Railway, Merseyrail, Northern, TransPennine Express, Transport for Wales purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine (TVM): i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
